CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 16, 1957, pg. A3 reads: "Plan Civil Defense - The above group of women took advantage of the Red Cross Home Nursing nad Family Survival Plan for Civil Defense course which was taught them by Mrs. Eunice Cook (center) of Hill City. Above are Mrs. Carlotta Jordon, president of Nurses of Monumental Baptist Church; Mrs. Emma Turner, Mrs. Ola L. Robinson, Mrs. Mathilda Leach, Mrs. Estelle Mays, Mrs. Anna B. Sinkfield, Mrs. Eva Rogers, Mrs. Ida L. Thomas, Mrs. Anna Spear, Mrs. Addie Fulton, Mrs. Elsie M. Kenendy, Mrs. Carrie Kidd, Mrs. Helen Hunter, Mrs. Alma Robinson, Mrs. Rosetta Crittingham and Denise Fulton. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of girl and fourteen women wearing nursing uniforms; including Carlotta Jordon, Emma Turner, Ola L. Robinson, Mathilda Leach, Estelle Mays, Anna B. Sinkfield, Eva Rogers, Ida L. Thomas, Anna Spear, Addie Fulton, Elsie M. Kenendy, Carrie Kidd, Helen Hunter, Alma Robinson, Rosetta Crittingham, and Denise Fulton, Eunice Cook seated in center wearing patch on sleeve that reads "...Red Cross", resting hands on open binder, gathered in interior with wood walls, Red Cross flag, and poster that reads "Arrive Alive Slow Down And Live"
